title.narrative: Emergency Supplies of NFIs for the Vulnerable People at Higher Risk of COVID19

description.narrative: The project provides for the prevention of, and preparedness for the Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19) outbreak through the provision of essential hygiene and disinfection materials and standard or customized NFIs and potable water to quarantine centers and vulnerable families. MA'AN will provide for adequate and gender sensitive response to address the needs of the most vulnerable families at higher risk of being affected by COVID-19. MA’AN capitalizes on its community-based emergency response structure. The proposed intervention should support MA'AN to replenish hygiene and dignity kits stockpiles to be positioned for emergency response, namely COVID-19 pandemic. Families and people at higher risk of being affected by COVID-19 should be supported with essential hygiene and disinfection materials. 1200 COVID 19 family hygiene and cleaning kits, enough for 1 month, will be positioned in advance to be provided for 1200 families including 2204 men, 2135 women, 2003 boys, and 2058 girls. A total of 6285 kits including 200 dignity kits (male/female children), 1000 dignity kits (female adults), 1000 hygiene kits (female adults), 1600 hygiene and dignity kits (male adults), 200 hygiene kits (children), 100 infant kits, and 2180 cleaning kits, will be prepared as stockpiles to serve 4236 individuals at quarantine facilities, including 2347 men, 1474 women, 220 boys, and 195 girls. The primary geographical target is the Northern Governorate and Gaza City. In coordination with the shelter cluster and the MoSD, MA'AN stocks will be available to address the emerging needs in the Middle Area and the Southern Governorates. In addition, MA'AN intervention includes to distribute quantities of potable water enough to meet the emerging needs of 1500 people in the quarantine facilities for twenty-one days. The potable water distribution will address the needs of the quarantine facilities in the five Governorates. The project applies community-based preparedness and emergency response mechanisms.
